clues.text: In size, it's the smallest independent country in the world
All 181 square miles of it are found in the eastern Pyrenees mountains
Discovered by Columbus in 1498, invaded by the U.S. in 1983
It's only 23 square miles & completely surrounded by Italy
The smallest island nation in the Mediterranean Sea

Popeye was a cartoon sailor; he was part of the triumvirate with Caesar & Crassus

Superman's classic nickname that's the material used in S.O.S. Pads for scouring & polishing

Elton John song that's a tribute to Marilyn Monroe & the residents of Toad Hall

clues.text: "Stand By Me" singer who sat on Egypt's throne from 1936 to 1952
"Soul Train" host & businessman nicknamed "Commodore" who made a fortune in steamship lines & railroads

Homer wrote that this Greek peak never has storms & basks in cloudless ether; guess he didn't really look at it
Pico de Aneto is the highest peak in this range that extends from the Bay of Biscay to the Mediterranean
The lower slopes of this 15,771-foot peak contain several glaciers including Mer de Glace

The Marine Corps' first amphibious landing took place in 1776 at New Providence in this island group in the West Indies

Technically, he's also the Member of Parliament for Sedgefield District

George Orwell, when he was born

Wharton won a Pulitzer Prize for this novel about Newland Archer, who falls in love with his wife's cousin
A poor farmer falls in love with his wife's cousin in this 1911 tale of tragic irony
To be too smart for your own good is to be "too clever by" this
At Northwestern University, classes in the winter one began Jan. 6, 2003
This common measurement for liquor makes about 17 cocktails
A bit is this fraction of a dollar

The one who was a participant in the famous gunfight at the O.K. Corral

First name of Daniel Defoe's Mr. Cronke, the Dumb Philosopher
Like the house cat, the house mouse uses these facial appendages to feel its way around in the dark
Grasshopper mice are known to do this, like a coyote or a Ginsberg
Bambi might know that when deer mice get excited they do this with their feet, like his rabbit friend
For most of a mouse's life, these teeth keep growing
If you eat like a harvest mouse you prefer to eat these, probably before they germinate

rounds.text: The 1877 novel "Garth", about a New Hampshire family cursed by an ancestor's crime, is by Julian, son of this novelist
